{"step_by_step_thinking": "The cribriform plate is part of the ethmoid bone and is located at the base of the skull. It supports the olfactory bulb and is perforated by olfactory foramina for the passage of olfactory nerves. Based on the information provided in the documents, the cribriform plate connects the nasal cavity and the anterior cranial fossa.", "answer_choice": "A"}
